metadata.title: CVE-2015-6771 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
js/array.js in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 47.0.2526.73,improperly implements certain map and filter operations for arrays, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memoryaccess) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScriptcode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.11.3-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.11.3-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.11.3-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.11.3-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.11.3-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.11.3-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218').
oxide-qt package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.11.3-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
